meanings.definition: Ambuscaders (noun): individuals who lie in wait to attack or ambush
meanings.sent1: The ambuscaders hid behind the trees, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
meanings.sent2: The ambuscaders surprised the enemy by attacking from their hidden positions.
meanings.sent3: The ambuscaders played a game of hide-and-seek, but instead of seeking, they were waiting to ambush.
meanings.sent4: The ambuscaders were like shadows, appearing out of nowhere to launch their surprise attack.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ambuscaders lurking in the shadows stayed with me long after the battle.

meanings.definition: Ambuscaders (verb): to lie in wait to attack or ambush
meanings.sent1: The soldiers ambuscaded behind the rocks, ready to ambush the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The bandits ambuscaded the travelers on the lonely road.
meanings.sent3: The cat ambuscaded the toy mouse, pouncing on it from its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The idea ambuscaded my mind, waiting for the perfect moment to surprise me.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day ambuscaded my thoughts, catching me off guard.
